:) Well said.
nomad <sasank@...> wrote:i have to agree with david on this point.
scapegoatism (for lac of a better word/or non word) is/has been prevelant umong state societies for over 8000 years
its so much easier to pick and something and make it the "evil" than to truly examine our own lives and culture for potential faults. humans (or all mammals for that matter) are addictive my nature, or you could say are driven internally to find patterns of behavior and lean on them. anything can be an addiciton, from the ritual you do when you start your day to the things you read, eat, the excersize you do. also anything that involves social behavoir as in chatting with friends can be very addictive. being social is also an intinctive drive. this is one of the great difficulties in breaking unhealthy habbits like smoking for instance in that it often involves having friends who also smoke and sharing and being friendly while doing so. if someone doesnt have much of a social life when they begin playing then the involvement that EQ requires with others as you get higher in levels could fill that need and being in a guild can for some create a psudo family.
perhaps it would be more productive to examine what is missing from society rather than attacking games, music or any non traditional group activities that are filling in that void.

just my humble thoughts

nomad

tundrawyrm <no_reply@yahoogroups.com> wrote:Guess I sound a little cold too but the topic of people not being
about to draw a line between real and make believe is not new,
shocking or uncommon. Everquest and other MMORPGs are fantasies
that we use to relieve stress and put the world away. back in the
70s we were playing Dungeons and Dragons for the same.
For some couping with the real world or people is too much and
they drive deeper into the fantasies we provide with our stories.
IS the problem with the GAME? no not really we are venting their
issues and in some ways showing a differant path to mental health.

A few people every year suicide because of role playing. Why?
becuece they put too much of them selves into their charactors. FOr
some it was they brought their toons into the real world and died
thinking they could have special powers if they really tried(guess
the pavement disagreed). For others their toon was them( the real
world person locked them selves in their own minds and only
interacted as the toon.( most of these we lock up in time but some
are missed) IN everquest most people have at least 3 toons( think I
have 11 on 3 servers over 3 years) this helps blur this line of who
they are in game and keeps them from getting fixated on one persona.

RPGers have Always been outside the main stream so more of us are
crazy or at least abnormal( as if we would wish to be normal).
Society has always labeled us as devil worshipers or crazy. We meet
in small rooms in back of comic shops becuase churches us. For
every suicide or killing( gamers were blamed for school shootings
REGULARLY) we all are blamed by society.

And on a last note back in the early 80s a book titled (What is
Dungeons and Dragons?) written by a pair of British gamers detailing
the history and world of RPGs for the main stream person is a great
aid for anyone writing about RPG MMORPG or gamers in general. IT
final shut my mother up on believing the bad press we always get.
THis is not the first 60 minutes story done attacking gameing and
far for the last( look at their type of viewers.. give the masses
what they want... worked for the Romans)
